captions.text: You might wonder why humans look the way we do
and how we ended up this way. Well it turns out the things our DNA is left
behind for the past few hundred thousand years
is mind-bogglingly cool.
While it's known that all humans develop a tale in the womb that eventually
dissolves, only the recently we've discovered where it might have come from
in the first place.
The world's most primitive primate whatever early ancestors
dryomomys
szalayi - slazi? slahzee? Spends most of it's life in trees.
which would have been a huge advantage for gathering food compared to other
land dweller some 56 million years ago.
It's very likely that this is how primates rocked it so hard in the animal kingdom.
for most of human evolution, every human head brown eyes.
That is until six to ten thousand years ago a genetic mutation from a single
person near the Black Sea changed
everything. This mutation affected the production of melanin the substance that
determines hair and skin color, and switched the color of the ice from brown
to blue. Somehow it spread across Europe in approximately eight percent of the
world's population has blue eyes. But it also means that every blue-eyed person
may share the same ancestor.
that's..that's kind of weird.  We're not 100 percent sure why we have as little hair on our
bodies as we do
but one theory is that we were finally walking upright in the ridiculously hot
African savanna
you know, evolving and what not, we had to rid ourselves of hair in order to cool
ourselves down.
Our hairlessness might have been seen as a sign of good health, making the less
hairy more attractive to the opposite sex.
Last but not least, before we evolved into humans,
the penises our primate ancestors were covered in hard spines.
Yeah you heard me. Theory suggests that the human males had the spines as a way
of removing the sperm of their competitors.
Which thankfully isn't as big a deal that was thousands of years ago
anyway, after we started more monogamous relationships, it makes sense the less
bumps we had in our penises
the better the sex. The better the sex the more monogamous the relationship.
So as the great Charles Darwin once said and I quote
evolution is totally also awesome.

title: Things Our Bodies Used To Have
